title: libgazebo9-dev deb package not correctly installing on Ubuntu 18.04 due to release 9.12

content.raw:
Congrats to all the team for the Gazebo 11 release!

In other news, we noticed some failures in our Nightly jobs that use Gazebo 9, in particular the error is:

```
Reading package lists...
Building dependency tree...
Reading state information...
Some packages could not be installed. This may mean that you have
requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable
distribution that some required packages have not yet been created
or been moved out of Incoming.
The following information may help to resolve the situation:
The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 libgazebo9-dev : Depends: gazebo9-common \(= 9.11.0-1~bionic\) but it is not going to be installed
 Depends: gazebo9-plugin-base \(= 9.11.0-1~bionic\) but it is not going to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
\##\[error\]Process completed with exit code 100.
```

‌

I tried to restart the job, but the error seems to be persistent. I also reproduce it locally, and it seems that the problem is that `libgazebo9-dev` version is still 9.11, while `gazebo9-common` and `gazebo9-plugin-base` were updated to 9.12 .

Full link to the failing job: [https://github.com/robotology/gazebo-yarp-plugins/runs/420659425](https://github.com/robotology/gazebo-yarp-plugins/runs/420659425)

‌

cc @{557058:155a32e2-420c-4d50-98e0-0e722f63f906}

Congrats to all the team for the Gazebo 11 release!

In other news, we noticed some failures in our Nightly jobs that use Gazebo 9, in particular the error is:

Reading package lists...
Building dependency tree...
Reading state information...
Some packages could not be installed. This may mean that you have
requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable
distribution that some required packages have not yet been created
or been moved out of Incoming.
The following information may help to resolve the situation:
The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 libgazebo9-dev : Depends: gazebo9-common \(= 9.11.0-1~bionic\) but it is not going to be installed
 Depends: gazebo9-plugin-base \(= 9.11.0-1~bionic\) but it is not going to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
\##\[error\]Process completed with exit code 100.

‌

I tried to restart the job, but the error seems to be persistent. I also reproduce it locally, and it seems that the problem is that libgazebo9-dev version is still 9.11, while gazebo9-common and gazebo9-plugin-base were updated to 9.12 .

Full link to the failing job: https://github.com/robotology/gazebo-yarp-plugins/runs/420659425

cc @Jose Luis Rivero
